me.p1: As a software developer with a passion for frontend development, I am constantly seeking out new technologies and approaches to improve my skills and enhance the user experience. With a curious and open mindset, I thrive on learning new things and taking on new challenges.
me.p2: If you're looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic software developer who is committed to staying at the forefront of the latest technologies, then please don't hesitate to reach out to me. I look forward to connecting with you!

work.title: Sneak Peek Into My Projects.
work.description: These are some of the projects I have worked on or contributed to.

projects.title: The Art of Creating
projects.description: The fourth iteration of my personal portfolio. With an artistic and minimalistic thought in the back of my head, I created this portfolio to showcase my work and skills as a software developer.

projects.title: Watt Can I Save
projects.description: An energy saving app developed during the 2022 BaselHack Hackaton which won the first prize.

projects.title: HAY (How Are You)
projects.description: An app aiming for a better mental health by connecting people with similar interests. It was developed during the 2023 Baselhack Hackaton and won the second prize.

projects.title: Spring Is Coming
projects.description: A weather app developed during a school assignement.

projects.title: Open MCT by NASA
projects.description: Open MCT (Open Mission Control Technologies) is a next-generation mission control framework for visualization of data on desktop and mobile devices.

projects.title: Cumulus by NASA
projects.description: Cumulus is an ESDIS Project effort to prototype and test how EOSDIS data collections can be archived collectively and disseminated in the commercial cloud.
